snippet.title: Three injured as crane crashes onto building at Wolli Creek
snippet.content:
Buildings have been evacuated after a crane collapsed at Wolli Creek this morning.
Chris Hook
Share
PARAMEDICS are treating three people after a crane toppled over and crashed onto an apartment building in Sydney's south today. No one was inside the crane at the time but three people received minor injuries when the crane toppled from one building to another at Brodie Spark Drive, Wolli Creek. Roads in the immediate area have been closed and two buildings have been evacuated as police established an exclusion zone.
The crane crashed onto the penthouse of the apartment building shortly after 9.30am this morning. Picture FacebookSource:The Daily Telegraph Photos posted by nearby residents show the top of the crane resting on the penthouse of the apartment complex. There are reports the building has suffered significant structural damage. Paramedics are treating three people at the scene but it is not yet known the extent of their injuries.
Three people are understood to have been inside the crane when it collapsed. Picture: FacebookSource:The Daily Telegraph Residents living in the adjoining buildings have expressed shock at the incident "Omg I was wondering what was going on with all the sirens, I hope everyone is safe," posted Bianca Fichino. Nikki Armitage wrote: "I feel sorry for the people in the penthouse, what a rude awakening." SafeWork NSW has been advised and will investigate the incident.
